Background & Problem 🔴 REQUIRED 182 + 183 + ### 6.1 Business Context 184 + 185 + **Why this matters**: 186 + - **Customer Trust**: When issues occur, customers expect quick resolution. Without proper logging, troubleshooting becomes + guesswork. 187 + - **Regulatory Compliance**: SOC 2, GDPR, and other regulations require audit trails. 188 + - **Operational Efficiency**: Teams spend 40% less time debugging with good logs. 189 + 190 + **User impact**: 191 + - Support teams can resolve issues 3x faster 192 + - Security teams can investigate incidents thoroughly 193 + - DevOps teams can proactively prevent outages 194 + 195 + **Cost of inaction**: 196 + - Extended downtime during incidents 197 + - Failed compliance audits 198 + - Inability to detect security breaches 199 + - Lost customer trust 200 + 201 + ### 6.2 Technical Context 202 + 203 + **Current state**: 204 + - Components use different logging formats 205 + - No consistent correlation across services 206 + - Difficult to trace requests through the system 207 + - Logs scattered across multiple locations 208 + 209 + **Limitations**: 210 + - Can't correlate user actions across services 211 + - Hard to filter signal from noise 212 + - No standard retention policies 213 + - Performance impact unmeasured 214 + 215 + **Technical debt**: 216 + - Ad-hoc logging implementations 217 + - Plain text logs in some components 218 + - Missing security event logging 219 + - No log rotation in some services 220 + 221 + ### 6.3 Constraints 222 + 223 + | Type | Constraint | Impact | 224 + |------|------------|--------| 225 + | ⏰ **Time** | Must implement within Phase 0 | Critical for all subsequent phases | 226 + | 💰 **Budget** | Use existing infrastructure | No new logging services initially | 227 + | 👥 **Resources** | Current dev team | Must be simple to adopt | 228 + | 🔧 **Technical** | Must work with Rust ecosystem | Use tokio-compatible libraries | 229 + | 📜 **Compliance** | SOC 2 requirements | Must have audit trails | 230 + 231 + ## 7. Decision 🔴 REQUIRED 232 + 233 + ### 7.1 Y-Statement Format 234 + 235 + > In the context of **building a multi-tenant AI platform**, 236 + > facing **inconsistent logging and compliance requirements**, 237 + > we decided for **structured JSON logging with correlation IDs** 238 + > and neglected **plain text logs and proprietary formats**, 239 + > to achieve **observability, compliance, and debuggability**, 240 + > accepting **slight performance overhead and larger log sizes**, 241 + > because **the benefits of structure and searchability outweigh the costs**. 242 + 243 + ### 7.2 What We're Doing 244 + 245 + We are standardizing all CODITECT components to use: 246 + 1. **Structured JSON logging** for machine parseability 247 + 2. **Correlation IDs** for request tracing 248 + 3. **Log levels** (TRACE, DEBUG, INFO, WARN, ERROR) for filtering 249 + 4. **Consistent field names** across all services 250 + 5. **Automatic PII redaction** for compliance 251 + 6. **Configurable retention policies** per log type 252 + 253 + ### 7.3 Why This Approach 254 + 255 + **Structured JSON** enables: 256 + - Automated parsing and analysis 257 + - Easy integration with log aggregators 258 + - Consistent field extraction 259 + - Complex queries and filtering 260 + 261 + **Correlation IDs** provide: 262 + - End-to-end request tracing 263 + - Multi-service debugging 264 + - Performance analysis 265 + - User journey tracking 266 + 267 + **This approach balances**: 268 + - Developer experience (easy to implement) 269 + - Operational needs (easy to search) 270 + - Compliance requirements (audit trails) 271 + - Performance impact (minimal overhead) 272 + 273 + ## 8. Core Concepts 274 + 275 + ### 8.1 Log Levels Explained 276 + 277 + | Level | When to Use | Business Impact | Example | 278 + |-------|-------------|-----------------|---------| 279 + | **ERROR** | System failures | Service degradation | "Database connection failed" | 280 + | **WARN** | Potential issues | May need attention | "API rate limit approaching" | 281 + | **INFO** | Normal operations | Business events | "User logged in successfully" | 282 + | **DEBUG** | Troubleshooting | Developer info | "Cache miss for key X" | 283 + | **TRACE** | Detailed flow | Deep debugging | "Entering function Y" | 284 + 285 + ### 8.2 Correlation ID Journey 286 + 287 + ``` 288 + User clicks "Create Project" → Browser generates request-id: abc-123 289 + ↓ 290 + API Gateway receives request → Adds correlation-id: abc-123 291 + ↓ 292 + Auth Service validates token → Logs with correlation-id: abc-123 293 + ↓ 294 + Project Service creates project → Logs with correlation-id: abc-123 295 + ↓ 296 + Database writes data → Logs with correlation-id: abc-123 297 + ↓ 298 + Response sent to user → Final log with correlation-id: abc-123 299 + 300 + Result: Complete request journey traceable with single ID 301 + ``` 302 + 303 + ### 8.3 Structured vs Unstructured 304 + 305 + **Unstructured** (What we avoid): 306 + ``` 307 + 2025-08-31 14:30:45 INFO User john@example.com logged in from 192.168.1.1 308 + ``` 309 + 310 + **Structured** (What we use): 311 + ```json 312 + { 313 + "timestamp": "2025-08-31T14:30:45Z", 314 + "level": "INFO", 315 + "component": "api.auth", 316 + "action": "user_login", 317 + "user_id": "user-123", 318 + "correlation_id": "req-456", 319 + "message": "User login successful", 320 + "metadata": { 321 + "ip": "192.168.1.1", 322 + "user_agent": "Mozilla/5.0..." 323 + } 324 + } 325 + ``` 326 + 327 + ## 9. Business Benefits 328 + 329 + ### 9.1 Faster Issue Resolution 330 + 331 + - **Before**: "Customer says something is broken" → Hours of investigation 332 + - **After**: "Error at 14:30" → Find all related logs in seconds 333 + 334 + ### 9.2 Compliance Readiness 335 + 336 + - **Audit Requirement**: "Show all actions by user X in the last 30 days" 337 + - **With Structured Logs**: Simple query returns complete audit trail 338 + 339 + ### 9.3 Proactive Monitoring 340 + 341 + - **Pattern Detection**: Identify issues before customers notice 342 + - **Usage Analytics**: Understand how customers use the platform 343 + - **Performance Tracking**: Find and fix bottlenecks 344 + 345 + ### 9.4 Security Benefits 346 + 347 + - **Intrusion Detection**: Spot suspicious patterns 348 + - **Incident Response**: Quickly understand breach scope 349 + - **Forensic Analysis**: Complete evidence trail 350 + 351 + ## 10. Security & Compliance 352 + 353 + ### 10.1 What We Never Log 354 + 355 + ❌ **NEVER log these**: 356 + - Passwords or authentication tokens 357 + - Credit card numbers 358 + - Social Security numbers 359 + - API keys or secrets 360 + - Personal health information 361 + - Unencrypted PII 362 + 363 + ✅ **Safe to log**: 364 + - User IDs (not emails) 365 + - Action types 366 + - Timestamps 367 + - IP addresses (if needed) 368 + - Error messages (sanitized) 369 + - Performance metrics 370 + 371 + ### 10.2 Compliance Mapping 372 + 373 + | Regulation | Requirement | How Logging Helps | 374 + |------------|-------------|-------------------| 375 + | **SOC 2** | Audit trails | Every action logged with user ID | 376 + | **GDPR** | Data processing records | Track all PII operations | 377 + | **HIPAA** | Access logs | Monitor health data access | 378 + | **PCI DSS** | Security monitoring | Detect suspicious activities | 379 + 380 + ### 10.3 Retention Policies 381 + 382 + | Log Type | Retention | Reason | 383 + |----------|-----------|---------| 384 + | **Audit Logs** | 7 years | Compliance requirements | 385 + | **Security Logs** | 1 year | Incident investigation | 386 + | **Application Logs** | 90 days | Troubleshooting | 387 + | **Debug Logs** | 7 days | Short-term debugging | 388 + | **Trace Logs** | 24 hours | Detailed troubleshooting | 389 + 390 + ## 11. Operational Excellence 391 + 392 + ### 11.1 Log Management Lifecycle 393 + 394 + ```mermaid 395 + graph LR 396 + A[Generate] --> B[Collect] 397 + B --> C[Process] 398 + C --> D[Store] 399 + D --> E[Analyze] 400 + E --> F[Archive] 401 + F --> G[Purge] 402 + 403 + style A fill:#e3f2fd 404 + style B fill:#bbdefb 405 + style C fill:#90caf9 406 + style D fill:#64b5f6 407 + style E fill:#42a5f5 408 + style F fill:#2196f3 409 + style G fill:#1e88e5 410 + ``` 411 + 412 + ### 11.2 Operational Patterns 413 + 414 + **Real-time Monitoring**: 415 + - Dashboard shows error rates 416 + - Alerts on anomalies 417 + - Correlation with metrics 418 + 419 + **Troubleshooting Workflow**: 420 + 1. Customer reports issue 421 + 2. Find correlation ID from error 422 + 3. Query all logs with that ID 423 + 4. See complete request flow 424 + 5. Identify root cause 425 + 426 + **Capacity Planning**: 427 + - Track log volume growth 428 + - Monitor storage usage 429 + - Plan retention adjustments 430 + 431 + ## 12. Performance Impact 432 + 433 + ### 12.1 Expected Overhead 434 + 435 + | Operation | Impact | Mitigation | 436 + |-----------|--------|------------| 437 + | **JSON Serialization** | ~1ms per log | Async logging | 438 + | **Disk I/O** | Varies | Buffer writes | 439 + | **Network** | If remote | Local collector | 440 + | **CPU** | < 2% | Sampling for trace | 441 + | **Memory** | ~50MB buffer | Bounded queues | 442 + 443 + ### 12.2 Performance Best Practices 444 + 445 + ✅ **DO**: 446 + - Use async logging 447 + - Buffer log writes 448 + - Sample trace logs 449 + - Rotate logs regularly 450 + - Compress old logs 451 + 452 + ❌ **DON'T**: 453 + - Log in tight loops 454 + - Log large objects 455 + - Use synchronous writes 456 + - Forget log levels 457 + - Log sensitive data 458 + 459 + ## 13. Migration & Adoption 460 + 461 + ### 13.1 Adoption Strategy 462 + 463 + **Phase 1: New Components** (Week 1-2) 464 + - All new code uses standard 465 + - Provide examples and templates 466 + - Set up shared libraries 467 + 468 + **Phase 2: Critical Services** (Week 3-4) 469 + - Migrate auth service 470 + - Migrate API gateway 471 + - Ensure correlation IDs flow 472 + 473 + **Phase 3: All Services** (Week 5-8) 474 + - Systematic migration 475 + - Update monitoring 476 + - Deprecate old formats 477 + 478 + ### 13.2 Developer Education 479 + 480 + **Training Materials**: 481 + - Code examples for each language 482 + - Integration guides 483 + - Best practices checklist 484 + - Common mistakes to avoid 485 + 486 + **Support Process**: 487 + - Slack channel for questions 488 + - Code review focus on logging 489 + - Paired programming sessions 490 + - Regular knowledge sharing 491 + 492 + ## 14. Consequences 🔴 REQUIRED 493 + 494 + ### 14.1 Positive Outcomes 495 + 496 + ✅ **Immediate Benefits**: 497 + - Faster debugging and troubleshooting 498 + - Compliance audit readiness 499 + - Improved security monitoring 500 + - Better system understanding 501 + 502 + ✅ **Long-term Benefits**: 503 + - Reduced operational costs 504 + - Proactive issue prevention 505 + - Data-driven improvements 506 + - Enhanced platform reliability 507 + 508 + ✅ **Team Benefits**: 509 + - Less time firefighting 510 + - More confidence in changes 511 + - Better on-call experience 512 + - Clearer system behavior 513 + 514 + ### 14.2 Negative Impacts 515 + 516 + ⚠️ **Short-term Costs**: 517 + - Migration effort required 518 + - Increased storage usage 519 + - Learning curve for teams 520 + - Initial performance tuning 521 + 522 + ⚠️ **Ongoing Considerations**: 523 + - Storage costs will increase 524 + - Need log retention management 525 + - Requires monitoring setup 526 + - Must maintain standards 527 + 528 + ⚠️ **Technical Debt**: 529 + - Legacy log parsers needed temporarily 530 + - Dual logging during migration 531 + - Some third-party integration challenges 532 + 533 + ### 14.3 Risk Mitigation 534 + 535 + | Risk | Probability | Impact | Mitigation | 536 + |------|-------------|--------|------------| 537 + | **Storage overflow** | Medium | High | Implement retention policies | 538 + | **Performance impact** | Low | Medium | Use async logging | 539 + | **Adoption resistance** | Medium | Medium | Provide great tooling | 540 + | **Compliance gaps** | Low | High | Regular audits | 541 + 542 + ## 15.
